Name: Statue of Hapi as a Mummy
Description: The gilded wooden statue depicts Hapi, the god of the Nile, standing on a small rectangular base. Hapi is usually portrayed as a fat bearded man with heavy breasts, wearing a crown of reeds and lotus blossoms. However, in this statue, Hapi is in the form of a mummy. His body is completely enveloped in a cloak and his arms are crossed on his chest, which is adorned with a large pectoral. The body is entirely gilded, except for his eyes, eyebrows, and false beard. He wears a three-part wig on his head.
